quest.name: Top of the Tree
journal: Cymet is staring intently in your general direction.
objectives: Speak with the residents of Fanow to gather information.

dialogue.name: CYMET
dialogue.text: This way, um... What is your name?

dialogue.name: CYMET
dialogue.text: Forename? ...And this is a common name nowadays? How times change.

dialogue.name: CYMET
dialogue.text: But I digress. Come, and be sure to watch your step.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: They call themselves Viis, is that right? Not a terribly diverse people from what I can see.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: For a moment, I was worried they wouldn't accept the seal.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: For three thousand years did they wait... Incredible.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: No dawdling. Once we have learned all we can of the Warden and its whereabouts, we should be on our way.

dialogue.name: UIMET
dialogue.text: My apologies for the hostile greeting.

dialogue.name: UIMET
dialogue.text: It is a miracle our arrows did not find their mark.

dialogue.name: CYMET
dialogue.text: If you would hear the tale of our people, speak with Almet. As eldest, she is our voice.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: As bearers of the seal, you have a right to know what became of the empire, and my people's purpose here.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: We are descendants of the palace guard which served under the last emperor. And to this day, we carry on the duty of our forebears, the final decree of His Eminence before Ronka's fall.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: “By the wisdom of our people was Ronka made to thrive. Such knowledge must never be forgotten, nor may it be suffered to fall into the hands of the wicked.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: “Keep it secret. Keep it safe. And look to the coming of our allies. Unto them you shall bequeath our all, and thus will Ronka live on.”

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: By his command we have remained in the Rak'tika Greatwood, guardians of Ronka's ruins, and the wisdom held within.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: I hope thou wilt not think the question impertinent, but did thy people's famed longevity perchance play a part in the emperor's decision to entrust this mission unto thee and thine?

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: That was one reason, yes. We Viis would easily live to see three of your elven lifetimes.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: We were also the fiercest fighters. There are none more fit than us to stand watch over the remains of Ronka.

dialogue.name: UIMET
dialogue.text: But our duty has grown ever more perilous in the wake of the Flood.

dialogue.name: CYMET
dialogue.text: Settlements such as this one were plentiful before the Light claimed dominion over the land. But now...

dialogue.name: CYMET
dialogue.text: Fanow is all that remains.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: Our numbers dwindle year by year...

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: Before long, there will be no one left to honor the emperor's wishes.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: And you believe we are the allies for whom you have waited?

dialogue.name: UIMET
dialogue.text: You have the seal, do you not!? After three millennia of waiting, that alone is nothing short of a miracle! Truth be told, I had begun to think you would never come!

dialogue.name: CYMET
dialogue.text: Sister!

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: We are glad of your presence here in the Greatwood.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: The wisdom of Ronka is yours should you wish it. You need only ask.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: You come in search of the Lightwarden...

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: My apologies, but I do not know where it makes its lair.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: Uimet, do you recall any sightings of this creature?

dialogue.name: UIMET
dialogue.text: Hmmm... Not these past thirty summers.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Thirty? But that would mean... How old are you, exactly?

dialogue.name: UIMET
dialogue.text: ...Young enough to remember!

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: With age comes knowledge. There may yet be one among us who has seen or heard of the abomination you seek.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We have leave to speak with the other Viis, then?

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: But of course.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Then we should split up and inquire individually. If someone knows something, I would hear it while there is yet time to act.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: In the name of Ronka and the late emperor, I promise we will do all we can to assist you and yours.

dialogue.name: UIMET
dialogue.text: Let not our looks deceive you. It is true we are still in our youth, but we are older than you might think.

dialogue.name: CYMET
dialogue.text: I pray you find the knowledge you seek. Oh, what I would not give to see the Warden brought low.

dialogue.name: KORILLE
dialogue.text: An outsider!? B-But how?

dialogue.name: KORILLE
dialogue.text: By the gods─allies of the empire! My sincerest apologies for failing to note your arrival.

dialogue.name: KORILLE
dialogue.text: It was the Warden you wished to know about, yes? My mother─may she rest in peace─told me once of its appearance in these woods.

dialogue.name: KORILLE
dialogue.text: Before settling here in Fanow, she lived in a village near Rak'tika Falls─until it was destroyed by the sin eaters.

dialogue.name: KORILLE
dialogue.text: While out on patrol one day, she spotted a swarm of the abominations, one of which was different from the rest.

dialogue.name: KORILLE
dialogue.text: It was larger, for one thing, but what struck her was the way its fellows seemed to revere it. She was convinced that what she had seen was the Lightwarden.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Your exchange with Korille has taught you something about the Lightwarden's possible whereabouts.

dialogue.name: KORILLE
dialogue.text: Would that my mother were still with us. I am certain she could help you find the Warden.

dialogue.name: NYMET
dialogue.text: It was not my intention to pry, but your voices carry far. I know what it is you would ask of me.

dialogue.name: NYMET
dialogue.text: Unfortunately the answer is no, I have not seen the Lightwarden. I patrol the ruins' perimeter regularly, and if it were hiding nearby, I would know about it.

dialogue.name: NYMET
dialogue.text: I apologize that I cannot be of more help, but I have told you all I know.

dialogue.name: LOYMET
dialogue.text: You search for the Lightwarden? I cannot say I have ever laid eyes on it.

dialogue.name: LOYMET
dialogue.text: Our duty is to protect the ruins, nothing more. We have no need to strike out in search of such a foe.

dialogue.name: LOYMET
dialogue.text: I see no reason to pursue one who poses no threat to the ruins.

dialogue.name: SHOINA
dialogue.text: The Lightwarden? No, I have not seen it.

dialogue.name: SHOINA
dialogue.text: But I have witnessed the horrors of the lesser eaters. How they are wont to hunt in packs and carry off their victims rather than consuming them on the spot.

dialogue.name: SHOINA
dialogue.text: I suspect the Warden is a grotesque, corpulent thing, waiting patiently for its minions to bring its next meal.

dialogue.name: SHOINA
dialogue.text: I have not seen the Lightwarden, and I pray I never do.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: No one I spoke to had seen hide nor hair of the Warden. But that may not be surprising, given their disinclination to stray far from the ruins.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: Did you have any luck speaking with the Viis?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Myriad are the tales the Viis did share with me. Alas, none made mention of the Warden or its lair.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Were you able to learn aught of the Warden's whereabouts?

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: I pray the others were able to provide what I could not.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: Near Rak'tika Falls!? Why was I not told of this?

dialogue.name: UIMET
dialogue.text: I think I see now why it has never been spotted on our patrols.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I have never heard of this Rak'tika Falls. I can but assume it lies deep within the woods of Yx'Maja.

dialogue.name: CYMET
dialogue.text: Just so. But the tunnel which leads there collapsed after a rather bloody battle with the eaters, and has not been passable for many years.

dialogue.name: CYMET
dialogue.text: We made several attempts to clear away the rubble, yet each time we were driven back. In the end, we were forced to give it up as lost.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: ...Thereby making it a suitable place for the Warden to take sanctuary.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: There is perhaps one way to enter. Though it would be at great peril to you and your companions.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: The Qitana Ravel, a temple to the northeast.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: It has been sealed for centuries, but within is a path that leads to the falls.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Can it be opened?

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: For the allies of Ronka, it can.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: First we must go to the K'mul Astropolis. Once the flow of magic is restored there, the path through the Qitana Ravel can be opened.

dialogue.name: UIMET
dialogue.text: This may sound a simple task, but there are certain...obstacles which prevent us from attending to it ourselves.

dialogue.name: UIMET
dialogue.text: ...And we know not how to overcome them.

dialogue.name: CYMET
dialogue.text: The emperor never granted our forebears leave to look upon the secrets we are charged with protecting. That we might not be tempted, the means to do so were withheld from us.

dialogue.name: CYMET
dialogue.text: We can but show you the way. The rest will be up to you.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: It would seem we have our work cut out for us, then. Shall we?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Did you have to ask?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: We've no time to waste.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: If we must.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Let us be about it then.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: If that is your wish, it is my duty to escort you.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: While we attend to matters at the K'mul Astropolis, I would ask that your sisters accompany Urianger and Thancred, and share with them all they can of these woods.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: While we have every intention of investigating Rak'tika Falls, 'tis yet possible the Lightwarden dwells elsewhere.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: With that in mind, it would behoove us to prepare an alternative course of action.

dialogue.name: ALMET
dialogue.text: Uimet. Cymet. I leave them to you.

dialogue.name: UIMET
dialogue.text: Yes, Sister.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Should our present course prove false, doubt not but that Thancred and I shall find any and all possible paths forward.
